Posts.Content: The epirubicin obliterates your hair - along with the cancer. I did cold cap two times. Cut my long hair into a bob night before first chemo by chemo 2 i had a friar tuck hairdo going on. I didnt bother for chemo 3 and it takes an hour off the treatment process. I wear a little cotton cap so it still looks like i have hair. I was really inspired by the ladies on this site who didnt use the cold cap and shaved their heads.  i am hanging onto my bits of hair but as chemo goes on, the hair issue seems a non-issue. As its cold, its the best time of the year to wear the selection of hats i bought pre-chemo.  Take care and best wishes x
Posts.Title: FEC-T and Cold Cap

Posts.Content: My animals have always been my life so my heart is with you. Such a wicked blow to endure.  Hope you are okay. I know it might be a bit soon but will you consider another friend?  Take good care - it's very important after coming through all your treatment xxx
Posts.Title: What is it with cancer?

Posts.Content: Oh no! I am gutted for you. Sometimes it feels there is no justice in the world. You may have to bump along the bottom with your emotions for a while and then I sincerely hope you get another companion. I lost my 25!! year old burmese cat and straight after my mum (with breast c) still not got over it all. Try to think and stay positive for your health. Thinking of you xxxx
Posts.Title: What is it with cancer?

Posts.Content: Try not to take it to heart...maybe it is his way of dealing with it. My husband still treats my cancer as if i have a mild cold. He is away in Edinburgh, Aberdeen Dublin and Plymouth for my remaining chemos and i am relying on my friends for help and support. You concentrate on getting better and taking joy in what keeps your morale up. You are not alone and your husband may reveal his true feelings about your health when you least expect it. Ignore anyone who says the wrong thing - focus on being well and beating the cancer xx
Posts.Title: Husband remark to cancer

Posts.Content: I am 42, baby is now 18months and l have decided to take medical retirement in May, I get full pay till then  but will go from 2k to £300 a month. Eek! I can't even begin to imagine LIVING on it! But LIVING is my main interest now, I want to live and enjoy life and although my job was exciting, fast paced and generally fun, I can't hide behind a desk any longer. Scary...yes, but not as scary as what we ladies have faced, so am going to brace myself and....something always turns up. I have 5 months to sort my act out and quite unexpectedly, I have just started writing a short eccentric children's book, the first three chapters just flowed! You never know!  Looking into the New Year with a heart full of hope (oh...and  2 lucky dips!) X
Posts.Title: Retiring but scared...

Posts.Content: Personally, I am not even looking at the future state pension forecast as that problem would be a dream - to beat cancer, be cancer free and be living 25 years. I may have to go from a high professional position to be a cleaner or shop girl but that means I am fit enough to work
Posts.Title: Retiring but scared...

Posts.Content: Its good to let those emotions out. Sometimes its tiring being strong all the time! Dont forget you're only human. You can get back on with being strong now  big hug and lots of admiration to you and all the other ladies. Take good care x
Posts.Title: Had a wobbly and almost lost it!

Posts.Content: I was told by my consultant that a bit of what you fancy is fine - moderation of course. If your not on chemo or any particular meds you should be fine, (my bc nurse confirmed this) so enjoy a glass now as if you go on a treatment you may not feel like a glass of wine when you are able.  (have one for me!!)  xx
Posts.Title: Red wine

Posts.Content: Don't worry. I have a 1cm tumour on my liver...okay not the best news anyone wants to hear but there are lots of ways to deal with it: initially chemo or radio, an operation to remove that part if possible - depending where problem is. My consultant said the tumour could also be lasered or another method is frozen so it causes no further problem. The liver is an amazing organ too, it has the power to regenerate. Wait for your results before panicking and don't worry. I know that's easier said than done, but if you do have liver involvement there's a lot that can be done. Take care xx
